channel.title: Comments on: MongoDB: How to backup all the databases with one command
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: Nevra
item.dc:creator: Nevra
item.description: You saved my life. Thanks man!

item.title: By: alex
item.dc:creator: alex
item.content:encoded:
$page = 1;
if(!empty($_GET[‘page’])) {
$page = filter_input(INPUT_GET, ‘page’, FILTER_VALIDATE_INT);
if(false === $page) {
$page = 1;
}
}

// set the number of items to display per page
$items_per_page = 4;

// build query
$offset = ($page – 1) * $items_per_page;
$sql = “SELECT * FROM menuitem LIMIT ” . $offset . “,” . $items_per_page;

item.title: By: Maddyacca
item.dc:creator: Maddyacca
item.description: Finally got the real tutorial here.. Thanks a lot admin, if I don't get this, I was going to delete my Mongo DB.
